description: Sweet Bread Rolls made with milk and honey!

directions.step: Melt butter in the microwave and combine with the milk, honey and salt in a large mixing bowl.
Warm the water in the microwave and dissolve the yeast and the sugar in it.
While the yeast mixture sets for about 5 minutes, beat the eggs and add them to the milk mixture.
Pour the yeast mixture into the milk mixture and stir until smooth.
Add 1/2 of the flour and mix until smooth.
Gradually stir in the rest of the flour (or until the batter can no longer be mixed.)
Place the dough on a floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes.
Place the dough in a bowl, cover it with a towel and let rise for about 1 hour (or until it has roughly doubled in size.
Now make the rolls. The shape is arbitrary.
To make the cloverleaf rolls make three small 1 inch balls and place them together on the bottom of a muffin-tin.
To make the braid, make three 1 inch diameter, 10 inch logs, braid them and tuck in the ends. Place the braid on a sheet of parchment paper on a cookie sheet.
After the rolls are made and placed in their baking containers, let the dough rise for a second time for 30-45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit
Beat an egg with 1 tablespoon of water and brush this egg wash on the surface of the dough before baking.
Bake the rolls. (about 15 minutes for the small rolls and 30 minutes for the braid or until surface turns a nice golden color)
